data.title: Auction Your Jackie Kennedy Autograph at Nate D. Sanders Auctions
data.meta_description: FREE APPRAISAL. To auction, buy, consign or sell your Jackie Kennedy autograph that is for sale, please email Nate@NateDSanders.com or call (310) 440-2982.
data.meta_site_name: Hollywood Memorabilia, Fine Autographs, & Consignments Blog
data.text:
Consign your Jackie Kennedy autograph that is for sale. Contact [email protected] to sell your Jackie Kennedy autograph.

Jackie Kennedy Draft Autograph Letter Signed as First Lady — ”…Jack’s office is a madhouse as you can imagine…I wish he could get someone who knew something precious when they saw it…”

Jacqueline Kennedy autograph draft letter signed ”Jackie” on White House stationery, addressed to friend and philanthropist Jane Engelhard. Although Kennedy crosses out several sections of her letter, all content is still legible. One such section reads in part: ”…Jack’s office is a madhouse as you can imagine – Every now + then I hear something like the Montcalm business & it is so upsetting – Most of the time it goes amazingly well – but all the bright people work in politics & war & I wish he could get someone who knew something precious when they saw it for the thank you side – I will see that all is remedied and find that unknown man & get the book up in our own library – It is sad because if J had seen that book he would have brought it home. It is just the kind of thing he most appreciates. Daddy was in the Cincinnati & that book would be such a treasure I will find it…” Four page letter on two sheets, measuring 6.75” x 8.5”, is in near fine condition with only paper clip residue. Sold for $1,562.

Jacqueline Kennedy Autograph Note Written on the Eve of JFK’s 1960 Presidential Election — “…I will drive to Boston to join you to vote – I wouldn’t miss that for anything…”

Exceptional, one-of-a-kind Jacqueline Kennedy autograph note unsigned, dated 7 November 1960 on official “John F. Kennedy For President” stationery. Jackie handwrites her notes for a live televised appearance on the eve of JFK’s Presidential election, reading in part: “…Thank you Jack – I’ve enjoyed watching this program so much tonight [JFK appeared on ABC television that night from 6-6:30 pm]…only wish that I could be there with you now – at the end of the long road that we started out on together last January in the primaries — But the doctor wouldn’t let me leave Hyannisport [Jackie was pregnant at the time]…tomorrow morning I will drive to Boston to join you to vote – I wouldn’t miss that for anything…we can wait out the election returns together…” Penciled note measures 8.25″ x 7″ and is nicely framed and matted with a transcript to an overall size of 15″ x 20″. Near fine. Sold for $1,460.

Jackie Kennedy Autograph Note

Jacqueline Kennedy Unsigned Note as First Lady — Redecorating of the White House — “…I agree with you the price for a rug is madness…” Sold for $1,300.

Consign your Jackie Kennedy autograph that is for sale. Contact [email protected] to sell your Jackie Kennedy autograph.

First Lady Jacqueline Kennedy 1961 Autograph Letter Signed

Jacqueline Kennedy autograph letter signed dated 31 October 1961, on White House letterhead. Jackie writes to James Fosburgh, the chairman of the paintings committee, asking for advice on lighting the paintings in the White House Red Room. In part: “…I am sure the way you have lighted your pictures will be a solution to our problem – so if there is anything we should do to Red Room before walls are rehung – would you tell Janet…Thanks – JBK”. One page letter, written in blue ink, measures 5″ x 8″. Some creasing, else very good. Sold for $1,168.

Auction your Jackie Kennedy autograph that is for sale. Contact [email protected] to sell your Jackie Kennedy autograph.

Autographs of Both JFK and Jackie on a Greeting Card Where Jackie Writes a Note

Greeting card signed by both John F. Kennedy and Jackie. Greeting card is signed simply “Jack” beneath a handwritten sentiment by Jackie Kennedy, who signed “Mrs. Jack”. Her note within reads, “Dear Mrs Deignan, what would we have done without our trained nurse! Many thanks from the grateful patient + Mrs. Jack / Jack”. Accompanied by the original envelope also bearing Jackie’s writing of the addressee’s name. Card measures 4.5″ x 6″. Near fine. Originally from the estate of Rose Kennedy’s driver and maid. Sold for $1,100.

Consign your Jackie Kennedy autograph that is for sale. Contact [email protected] to sell your Jackie Kennedy autograph.

Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis Handwritten Check Signed — in Near Fine Condition With No Cancellation Stamps

Quite rare check signed in full, “Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis” made payable to Jackie’s friend Chris Black. Entirely handwritten by Jackie Kennedy, check is dated 5 February 1984 for $65. Written upon her personal check, which is printed “Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis” at top. Measures 6″ x 2.75″ In near fine condition with no cancellation marks or endorsement, indicating that the recipient never cashed it. Sold for $1,025.

Consign your Jackie Kennedy autograph that is for sale. Contact [email protected] to sell your Jackie Kennedy autograph.

Jackie Kennedy Onassis DS

Jacqueline Kennedy signed Massachusetts driver’s license application from 1970, filled out in her hand. Partially-printed DMV document is signed, “Jacqueline B. Onassis” and filled out in type with a few handwritten checkmarks and the word “No” written 5 times, along with her handwritten social security number. A typed line to verso reads, “Change of name via marriage Kennedy to Onassis”. Measures 5″ x 3.25″. Perforated cancellations not affecting signature. Near fine. Sold for $990.

Auction your Jackie Kennedy autograph that is for sale. Contact [email protected] to sell your Jackie Kennedy autograph.

Jacqueline Kennedy Signed Book as First Lady in 1961

Jackie Kennedy book signed as First Lady during the first few months of JFK’s presidency. Titled ”The Antiques Treasury”, Jackie inscribes the front free endpaper, ”For Clarinda de Prado / A little souvenir of Williamsburg / Jacqueline Kennedy / September 20 1961”. Published by Antiques Magazine, E.P. Dutton & Company: New York: 1959, book showcases the anitiques and furnishings of seven historic estates. Runs 319pp. Bound in green paper boards with green faux leather spine and gilt lettering. Measures 9.5” x 12.25”. Boards are detached, rings to front cover and surface loss to board edges; fair condition, though easily restored. Accompanied by an 8” x 10” black and white photo of the Kennedys with Peruvian President and Mrs. Manuel Prado Ugarteche. Sold for $938.

Jackie Kennedy Autograph Letter Signed — Circa 1960 — Signed ”Jacqueline Kennedy” and Also ”Mrs. John F. Kennedy”

Undated Jackie Kennedy autograph letter signed from her Georgetown address in Washington, D.C. The single page letter, apparently the last page of a longer letter, reads, ”2) Please don’t make the bureau any higher, to include 3rd shirt drawer. Thank you so much / Sincerely / Jacqueline Kennedy / P.S. You might let me know how deep present shirt drawers are.” She also writes her return address in the lower left corner: ”Mrs. John F Kennedy / 3307 N St NW / Washington DC”. This house is where the Kennedy family lived from 1957 to when JFK was elected to the Presidency. Folds and holes from previous stapling to 6.25” x 6.25” pale blue stationery, not affecting signature. Overall very good. Sold for $916.

Jackie Kennedy Signed Photo of the Kennedy Family at the Winter White House in Palm Beach — From Their Last Easter Together in 1963

Jackie Kennedy signed photo of her with President Kennedy and their children, taken on Easter in 1963 at their Palm Beach, Florida home. The First Lady inscribes the mat below the photo, ”To – Estelle Prejs / With best wishes / Jacqueline Kennedy”. Silver gelatin matte photo measures 7.25” x 9.5”, with entire presentation measuring 11” x 14”. Minute discoloration along top of mat and a few spots at bottom, otherwise near fine. Sold for $750.

Jackie Kennedy Annotated Letter

First Lady Jacqueline Kennedy’s Penciled Notes on White Stationery Regarding a Lincoln/Grant Painting — 5″ x 8″ — Near Fine. Sold for $489.

Consign your Jackie Kennedy autograph that is for sale. Contact [email protected] to sell your Jackie Kennedy autograph.

Jackie Kennedy Letter on White House Stationery — White House Art — “…the pictures we acquire should all have a certain reason and appropriateness for being in the White House…”

Jackie Kennedy letter on White House stationery, dated 11 May 1962, unsigned. Here, the First Lady writes to a Betty regarding the selection of official art to hang in the White House. She stresses the importance of finding patriotic art with historical resonance. Reads in part, “Here are the pictures I told you I would let you know about with a little resume about each….As you can see there are only eight pictures. That is because we decided the only way for our Committee to accomplish something really worthwhile, was to settle only for the best…All these pictures are very expensive — all have a reason for being in the White House. They are of great American or historical figures of interest…the pictures we acquire should all have a certain reason and appropriateness for being in the White House…” Letter on 2pp. measures 6″ x 9.25″ with minor toning and foxing, else near fine. Sold for $413.

Jackie Kennedy Autograph

“Jacqueline Kennedy” Signature Upon 6″ x 4.25″ Piece of Paper — Tape Over Top Part of Kennedy, Else Fine. Sold for $312.

Furthermore, we have sold many Jackie Kennedy owned and worn items including:

Jackie Kennedy Personally Owned & Worn Court-Style Shoes — The Style She Popularized — Shoes by Mancini

Pair of Jackie Kennedy’s shoes. Court-style shoes are exemplar of the style Jackie revived. Black leather heels feature a buckle detail and leather soles, made by Parisian designer Rene Mancini. Size 10 shoes show some scuffing and wear to heels, else near fine. Provenance from James H. Boyer, Sr., U.S. Capitol Police Officer and Kennedy chauffeur. Sold for $30,819.
